conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, floors are distinct planes, multiple faces per wall are visible, and the view is elevated/angled rather than top-down.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable volume and clean cutaway; minor simplifications at some wall junctions/edge conditions.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room adjacencies and main wall positions match (dining top-left, kitchen top-center, living right, bedroom bottom-left, bath core center). The bottom-right stair/UP zone from the 2D plan is not clearly represented as a stair volume in the 3D (reads more like a generic space/void), reducing layout fidelity. Some door/window placement appears simplified relative to the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present in expected rooms (dining set, kitchen cabinetry/appliances, living seating, bed, toilet/sink). Some elements are simplified and not all plan-indicated fixtures/details are modeled.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear and readable with adequate lighting; openings and partitions mostly legible. Minor ambiguity remains around the stair/entry zone detailing.

detected_errors.description: Stair/UP area shown prominently in the 2D plan (bottom-right) is not clearly modeled as a staircase in the 3D render, suggesting a functional/geometry mismatch in that zone.
Some doors/windows appear simplified or not perfectly aligned to the exact walls/opening sizes indicated in the 2D plan.

summary: A clearly valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout correspondence, but with notable mismatch/simplification in the stair/UP zone and some opening placements.
